dataList.dlg: It is not your bravery from which I find fault. Yet I would like to excuse myself if you are planning to charge them head-on with not so much as a plan... again.
No matter what trial... may strike us... we shan't ever...! No, I give up. I refuse to do this, this line is too ridiculously juvenile.
What, are you expecting me to 'cheer you on from the sidelines' or something? ... Nngh... ugh... Y-yay, y-you can do this.
If our Family saw us doing this, they'd all be very, very concerned. Perhaps Dulcinea would have simply found this ridiculous.
You don't plan on leaving them like that, do you? Finish them off for good.
You should stop letting your guard down... But I know that you have more in you. Let us give it another attempt.
One dreary battle comes to an end.
... I'll put you out of people's sight, so regenerate swiftly and return to the field of battle. You're not planning on ending this adventure here, are you?

What is this unwise battle strategy...? No, why am I even asking? You are trying to reenact one of those ridiculous tales from the books, aren't you? You are knocking centuries off my lifespan, Father.
I will not worry, for you must already be certain of your victory.

We do not have much time to complete this contract. We will likely not meet the deadline should we dally here any longer than necessary.
... I did warn you that we should take on a different contract.
This is no common foe... Do not let your guard down this time, and pay close attention to their patterns.
This is reminiscent of our battle against the giants. Focus, unless you wish them to thrash and send you flying again. I won't be there to catch you this time.
An effective strike. Perhaps you should try this angle of attack again.
Father, that weapon is ineffective against this foe... haah...
A well-aimed strike against their weakness. I see that you have fast grown accustomed to the Fixers' techniques.
... Please do not attempt such clumsy attacks again. You have a reputation to maintain... at least while I am watching.
You may have been taunting them too roguishly... They look serious.

... It seems that your ridiculous way of speaking has its merits, Father.
The foe appears infuriated to the point of losing their senses.
... Where did you find that? I can't believe you actually found something of use. Let us take advantage of it now.
What's this now...? Did they swindle you into purchasing a fake Relic? Again?
Well cut. Your skills with the blade are now as nearly adept as Nicolina's.
We should be able to obliterate them in three seconds, should we unleash our true strength, but I find facing them head-on one-by-one oddly... enjoyable as well.
Haven't I warned you time and again to not let your guards down...?
I... can accept your fantasies of becoming a Fixer who must face and overcome such trials and tribulations. But can you please stop deliberately putting ourselves in those such tribulations?
Now, that's slightly closer to your true power. Can't we just do this every day?

I suppose he'll be talking the taverngoers' ears off with his tales of heroics again...
Mm. This may have been another tale worth sharing with Bari.
... It seems that this adventure of ours will meet a rather fine conclusion this time. ... Ahem, hm. It's nothing.
You are asking more of me after what I did for the La Manchaland narration? What kind of ridiculousâ€” Haah... I will do it. This was not a refusal.
